name: Oakbrook Center
description: Anchored by Neiman Marcus, Nordstrom, Macy’s, Lord & Taylor and Sears, Oakbrook Center is the Chicago-area shopping destination which offers five premier department stores and over 160 upscale specialty shops. Surrounded by gardens filled with flowers, fountains, trees and ponds, this open-air center attracts a wide customer base from the entire Chicago metropolitan area and the Midwest.

overview.type: Mixed-use, open-air, super-regional and three-office-tower complex
overview.anchorTenants: Lord & Taylor, Macy's, Neiman Marcus, Nordstrom, Sears

name: Water Tower Place
description: At the pinnacle of Chicago’s famed Magnificent Mile, Water Tower Place is Chicago’s premier shopping, dining and entertainment destination. Water Tower Place is a favorite among residents and has become one of the foremost tourist attractions in the city.

location.crossStreets: Michigan Avenue at Pearson and Chestnut

overview.anchorTenants: Macy's, American Girl Place and Broadway in Chicago's Broadway Playhouse

name: Stonetown Galleria
description: Located in affluent San Francisco, Stonestown Galleria offers an outstanding collection of retailers in a beautiful indoor setting. Top performing categories such as women’s apparel, shoes and jewelry and several new-to-market concepts, including Typo, Lorna Jane, City Sports Club and Lovesac, make this shopping destination a favorite for locals and visitors alike.

overview.anchorTenants: Nordstrom, Macy's, Trader Joe's, City Sports Club and The Sports Authority

name: Market Place Shopping Center
description: Retail mix unmatched in Central Illinois includes Sephora, Banana Republic, Pandora, Eddie Bauer, Teavana, White House|Black Market, Forever 21, LOFT, Old Navy, American Eagle Outfitters and Pink. Located between Chicago, St. Louis and Indianapolis. A 600-seat Food Court with eight quick-serve restaurants, featuring a beautiful antique carousel. Full-service restaurants include Buca di Beppo and Old Chicago.

location.interstateAccess: Two miles east of interchange I-57 and I-74

overview.anchorTenants: Bergner's, Macy's, and JCPenney. Gordmans and Kohl’s are located in Market Place Plaza

name: Crossroads Center
description: In 2004 Crossroads Center strengthened its strong presence in the market with an aggressive expansion and renovation. These exciting changes include additional skylights, 700-seat Food Court, family restrooms, improved traffic flow and parking, streamlined common area and children’s soft play area.

location.interstateAccess: Visible from and located directly off of Highway 15, exit West Division Street

name: The Maine Mall
description: The Maine Mall, located in South Portland, ME, lies 45 miles north of the Maine/New Hampshire border and adjacent to Maine’s largest city, Portland. The mall is easily accessible via dedicated exits from both I-95, the significant north-south corridor in the state of Maine, and I-295, the “interbelt” that connects I-95 to Portland.

location.crossStreets: Maine Mall Road and Gorham Road

overview.type: One-level, enclosed, super regional shopping center
overview.anchorTenants: Macy’s, Bon-Ton, JCPenney, Sears, Sports Authority and Best Buy

name: Mizner Park
description: Boca Raton’s Mizner Park is a pioneering downtown mixed-use project that includes 236,000 square feet of retail space, 267,000 square feet of office space, luxury retail apartments, town homes and cultural arts space, as well as a 5,000-person-capacity amphitheater. Mizner Park offers a signature business address for professionals. Choose from the seven-story Office Tower or the Plaza Real offices overlooking the vibrant setting of Mizner Park. Named one of America’s Top Public Places in 2010 by the American Planning Association, Mizner Park offers visitors a remarkable experience of culture, shopping, dining and entertainment in an open-air environment.

location.metroCenter: West Palm Beach & Fort Lauderdale, FL

name: Shops at Merrick Park
description: World renowned luxury retailers, including Gucci, Burberry, CH Carolina Herrera, Diane von Furstenberg, Jimmy Choo and Tiffany & Co. complement the fashion anchors.

overview.type: Open-air luxury retail center in mixed-use environment

name: Bayside Marketplace
description: Bayside Marketplace, located on Biscayne Bay, is a two-level, open-air center with over 140 stores, shops and restaurants, including national and regional merchants.

overview.type: Two-level, open-air center with over 140 stores, shops and restaurants, including national and regional merchants

name: Glendale Galleria
description: Glendale Galleria has long been a star in the LA retail scene and is renowned for being THE place to launch new and cutting-edge retail concepts including the world’s first Apple store, The LEGO Store, Disney Store, Pandora, Just Fab and Cotton On. Being known for having leading edge influence in establishing first-to-market retail concepts and high-volume national tenants, Glendale Galleria sets itself apart from the competition. Now this exciting makeover will help The Galleria to shine even brighter than before.

location.crossStreets: Broadway, Colorado, Columbus, Brand, and Central.
location.interstateAccess: Golden State Freeway (5), Ventura Freeway (134,101) and Glendale Freeway (2)

overview.type: Mixed-use, multi-level, enclosed super regional shopping center and office tower complex

name: Northridge Fashion Center
description: More than 18 million shoppers per year. Fashionable lineup of more than 170 specialty stores, including H&M, Abercrombie & Fitch, Aéropostale, ALDO, American Eagle Outfitters, Banana Republic, Victoria’s Secret, Forever 21, Disney Store, Gymboree, Hollister Co., Charlotte Russe, Sephora, Express, GUESS, Macy’s, JCPenney, Sports Authority, Starbucks, PINK and Steve Madden.

location.interstateAccess: Three miles from Hwy. 118, 5 miles from Hwy. 101, 5 miles from 405

overview.anchorTenants: JCPenney, Macy's, Macy's Men's & Home, Sears, Pacific Theatres

name: Saint Louis Galleria
description: ST. LOUIS’ PREMIER SHOPPING CENTER - Where the best stores put their best store. 165 specialty stores—more than 25 of which are exclusive within the St. Louis area. Outstanding exclusive retail stores including Anthropologie, The Bose Store, Disney Store, Hanna Andersson, Lacoste, LUSH, Marmi, Microsoft, Restoration Hardware, Tommy Bahama, True Religion Brand Jeans, Urban Outfitters, Vera Bradley and West Elm. Restaurant lineup include: The Cheesecake Factory, California Pizza Kitchen, Five Guys Burgers and Fries, Nordstrom Bistro and Saint Louis Bread Co. Saint Louis Galleria is one of St. Louis’ top tourist destinations with approximately 13% of its annual traffic coming from out-of-town guests. Located one mile from the prestigious Clayton central business district, which boasts 30,000 employees and a daily in/out population of 80,000.

location.crossStreets: I-64/Hwy 40 and I-170; Brentwood Blvd and Clayton Road

overview.type: Three-level enclosed, super regional shopping center

name: Plaza Frontenac
description: THE DESTINATION FOR LUXURY. Plaza Frontenac is the luxury fashion icon in the St. Louis area. Plaza Frontenac features some of the finest retailers in the country and is anchored by Missouri’s only Neiman Marcus and Saks Fifth Avenue. An exceptional lineup of dining options including Fleming’s Prime Steakhouse, BrickTop’s, BRIO Tuscan Grille and Cardwell’s at the Plaza. Home to one of St. Louis’ only Fine Arts Cinemas, Landmark Plaza Frontenac Cinema. With an impressive gathering of retailers, our top three performing categories are women’s apparel, home furnishings and apparel & accessories.

overview.anchorTenants: Neiman Marcus and Saks Fifth Avenue
